sub_title: Product owner- Product analyst- Data science- machine learning - Physics - Renewable energy -Zero Net goals
summary:
Product owner, helping Data Scientists to build new features for the product. I am tech savvy, being able to understand complex solutions like ML. Made big contributions as subject matter expert for science, technology and engineering databases.

Key words: (Product owner, product manager, Indexing specialist, Taxonomy expert, Thesaurus, Big data, Database manager, Machine Learning, Solar energy research )

education.field_of_study: Physics, Material Sciences and Solar cells.

awards.title: CODiE 2018 Awards Winner: Best Content Search & Discovery Solution
awards.description:
Elsevier's product, Engineering Village and my team, was recognized as the winner of the SIIA CODiE award for the "Best Content Search & Discovery Solution" for Numerical Filtering search capabilities.
The SIIA CODiE Awards is the only peer-reviewed program to showcase business and education technology’s finest products and services. Since 1986, thousands of products, services and solutions have been recognized for achieving excellence.

profile_positions.description:
Product workflow manager of a successful database (Compendex) with subject matter expertise in many sciences engineering and technology areas having experience with:
•  In-depth knowledge of domain specific engineering content databases. 
•  Solid IT project management, thesaurus management and content enrichment experience.
•  Spotting trends in scientific publications in-order to provide the most up to date thesaurus that makes information retrieval very consistent with existing content.
•  Using Machine Learning solutions for smart indexing of different types of content.
•  Improved content discovery for the users. (Achieving high precision and recall)
•  Taxonomy hierarchy and ontology development.
profile_positions.title: Product development Analyst ( www.Engineeringvillage.com)

profile_positions.description:
As a domain expert with both physics and engineering background, I was responsible for developing the indexing for scientific publications. Besides this, I have worked on improving the taxonomies and thesauri for many Engineering and Technology databases. 
Some milestones:
o	Indexing the entire content of our database by designing a new workflow.
o	Numerical indexing: The indexing of numerical values from scientific articles using a smart algorithm (the 2018 CODiE awards winner).
o	Leveraging the indexing quality (recall and precision) to a high level.
profile_positions.title: Domain Expert in scientific peer reviewed articles database. (Indexing and thesaurus specialist)

profile_positions.description:
Manager of a large and complex database system (Opsbank II) that contains the heading, abstract and reference information of millions of articles covering thousands of scientific journals. This database is the source repository for many successful Elsevier products like sciencedirect.com, scopus.com, Embase.com and engineeringvillage.com.

Some milestones:
o	Cited References Expansion project:
I managed the technology part of the project (workflow design, applications and production management) and was able to execute the production from supplier to product, resulting in the addition of 50 million references in first instance.
o	Design and maintenance of new production workflows like those for Articles in Press (AIP) from 18 publishers feeding Scopus and other products, Publisher Archives, Medline yearly backfill and Scopus deep archives mentioned above.
o	Being the technical single point of contact for all stakeholders. 
o	Bridging between product owners or users and the engineers within or outside Elsevier (Software suppliers).
o	Team lead of the Scopus Missing Content project.
profile_positions.title: Database and Application Manager (Scientific content workflow system)

profile_positions.description:
PhD Research Project, Mechanical Engineering Division at the Eindhoven University of Technology.

This PhD project was about the theoretical investigation of many prototypes of the Photovoltaic/ Thermal Combi-panels (PVT), which convert solar energy into both heat and electricity.
The objective was to establish a model for these hybrid solar panels that predicts both the energy efficiency and absorption parameters.
profile_positions.title: Postgraduate researcher at faculty of mechanical engineering, Energy technology group.

profile_positions.description: I investigated the effect of iron impurities in multicrystalline silicon material on the quality and efficiency of solar cells. The goal was improving the quality of silicon material used in photovoltaic ( solar energy) industry.
profile_positions.title: Student Researcher
